A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I know a lot of self described "Star Wars Fans" are bashing this film\, but it seems to me almost all of their complaints boil down to "I hate that women matter" or "Why didn't they do what I expected them to do." Needless to say these are very poor people to take reviews from unless you also hate women or only want to watch a film you yourself made. 

On the flip side this is a great movie. Very funny\, Very stunning visually. Full of surprises and awesome moments that will illicit audible outbursts of excitement. There are truly some of my favorite moments in a Star Wars film ever in this film. 

Does that mean it is perfect? No. It is flawed. It's pacing is a clear problem and could have been much shorter without question. Some of the character growth and side stories are overdone and brought little to the table. One character in particular I personally feel should have been allowed to die but again not my movie. 

Overall though this film follows very much in the tradition\, mythology\, lore and dogma of star wars and pushes the franchise forward in new and exciting ways. Could things have been done better\, sure. But were they done wrong\, no. Trust the critics see this film. But maybe leave your bias and expectations at the door.
